diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Familial hyperaldosteronism type III due to a novel Y152C KCNJ5 mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on clinical presentation of resistant hypertension, severe hypokalemia, and the identification of a novel KCNJ5 mutation (p.Y152C) through genetic sequencing, which resulted in mild phenotypic expression compared to other familial hyperaldosteronism types.
